known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Daily Wage Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The current system lacks automated salary calculation based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking of overtime and unpaid leaves.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: Significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation exists.

known_issues.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Daily Wage Formula
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings intentionally overrides the leave policy formula for unpaid leave. The greyed-out formula in leave policy indicates this override, causing user confusion about which formula is actually applied.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks clear visual communication about formula override mechanisms. Users cannot easily understand why formulas are greyed out or how payroll settings supersede leave policy configurations.
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules. Manual alignment is required.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were incorrectly based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in payroll calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change. | Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrect for Leap Years
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for leap years (specifically 2024), resulting in an inaccurate total service period and lower gratuity amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, causing potential underpayment of employee benefits.
known_issues.gap_statement: The EOS gratuity calculator requires enhancement to dynamically handle leap year calculations and automatically recognize 366-day years in service period computations.

known_issues.title: End of Service Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: Daily wage calculation for pro-rated amounts consistently produces amounts less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals. The formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but results in systematic undercalculation affecting all employees' end of service settlements.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation causing systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential product gap in financial calculation precision, specifically in pro-rated salary computations requiring enhanced rounding and decimal handling mechanisms.

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Complexity
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's gratuity calculation involves complex logic for handling partial years of service, especially for periods above 5 years. The system uses specific rules for calculating service duration, including leap year adjustments and day counting methodologies that may not be immediately intuitive to users.
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential lack of transparent calculation method for prorating gratuity in partial years | Need for more detailed, user-friendly explanation of gratuity calculation logic, including worked examples of service duration calculation for partial years and leap year handling.

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy with Leap Year Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (February 29th), causing minor discrepancies in total service days and resulting gratuity amount. The system calculated 912 days, while manual calculation showed 913 days by including the leap day.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently handled
known_issues.gap_statement: Need clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration calculations

known_issues.title: Days Worked Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: Platform calculates total job tenure with a potential extra day (623 days vs expected 622 days). Daily wage calculation uses a fixed 30-day divisor, which may not align with all client expectations of daily wage computation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Days worked calculation shows minor discrepancy in total days counted
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential inconsistency in days worked calculation method

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days. The daily wage is divided by a configured number of days (30 vs 31), potentially causing salary calculation differences.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations that may not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation about how leave salary calculations are performed, including daily rate divisor configurations.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Report Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Monthly working days impact daily wage calculations, causing accrual report variations
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Proration Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors (30 vs 30.42 days), causing calculation mismatches. This means the leave salary and salary proration use separate formulas, leading to inconsistent results.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration use independent daily wage configurations that may produce different calculation results.
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method exists across leave salary and salary proration scenarios.

known_issues.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was actually calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Salary proration depends entirely on work week configuration, which can include all 7 days as working days

known_issues.title: Proration Failure for Future Departure Dates
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator fails to correctly prorate salaries for employees with future departure dates during payroll processing. When an employee's departure date is set in the future (e.g., Nov 28th) but payroll is processed earlier (e.g., Nov 27th), the system fails to prorate the salary and displays the full monthly amount instead. The system correctly prorates when the departure date is in the past, but not when it's in the future relative to the payroll processing date.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The system lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic that can handle salary calculations for employees with future departure dates.
known_issues.gap_statement: Clear product gap in the daily wage calculator's ability to handle dynamic proration scenarios, particularly for employees with departure dates that differ from the payroll processing date.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Persistence After Deletion
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Deleting the leave request does not remove associated payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Mismatch
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system experiences data synchronization issues between Time Off and Payroll modules when public holidays are added after leave requests are created. This causes inconsistent daily wage calculations that cannot be retroactively corrected.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform lacks real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules, preventing automatic recalculation when public holidays are added after leave requests.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for module communication enhancement to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction across system configurations.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Reference in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays incorrect number of days (31 instead of 29) in February remarks for unpaid leave deduction, despite the underlying calculation being mathematically correct. This creates potential user confusion about the daily rate calculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Global Daily Rate Configuration Overrides Policy Settings
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that supersedes individual leave policy calculations, potentially causing incorrect unpaid leave deductions by using gross salary instead of basic salary.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is from the wrong month.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate display does not match the leave occurrence month, showing rates from the payroll processing month instead.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need a consistent daily rate display mechanism that preserves the initially calculated rate at the time of leave request.

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days per Month Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary is based on a standard of 26 working days per month, calculated as: 365 (Days yearly) - 52 (Weekly off) = 313 / 12 = 26.08 working days
limitations.impact: Rigid salary calculation method that does not flexibly account for individual employee attendance variations

limitations.title: Payroll Settings Take Precedence Over Leave Policy
limitations.limitation_statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration overrides leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations. Leave policy formula becomes non-editable (greyed out) when overridden.
limitations.impact: Users cannot directly modify daily wage calculation in leave policy when payroll settings are configured

limitations.title: Salary Config Creation Impacts Deduction Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Unpaid leave deductions depend on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect payroll deductions if salary configuration is not created before or updated with leave request

limitations.title: Incorrect Handling of Leap Year Days in Service Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: System defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize leap years with 366 days.
limitations.impact: Potential undercalculation of service-based benefits like end of service gratuity

limitations.title: Decimal Precision in Pro-Rated Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: Pro-rated daily wage calculations consistently produce amounts that are slightly less than expected due to decimal handling limitations.
limitations.impact: Potential financial discrepancies in end of service settlements for employees departing mid-month

limitations.title: Inflexible Leave Accrual for Mid-Month Departures
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave days are accrued at end of month, preventing inclusion of partial month leave for mid-month departures
limitations.impact: Employees departing mid-month cannot automatically include current month's leave balance in End of Service settlement

limitations.title: Service Duration Calculation Rules
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, including whether departure date is considered a working day and how leap year days are handled
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity calculations

limitations.title: Complex Handling of Incomplete Service Years
limitations.limitation_statement: System calculates partial years differently than manual calculations, using specific day-counting methods and adjusting for leap years by potentially using 366 as a divisor.
limitations.impact: Potential discrepancies between system and manual calculations for end of service (EOS) benefits

limitations.title: Fixed Daily Wage Divisor
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated using a hardcoded divisor of 30 days (Basic Salary / 30), which cannot be modified or configured to alternative formulas
limitations.impact: Prevents customization of daily wage calculation for different organizational requirements

limitations.title: Inflexible Daily Wage Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform's leave salary calculation follows a fixed policy setting that cannot be easily overridden for specific scenarios.
limitations.impact: Users cannot modify the standard calculation method to account for unique monthly variations or individual employee circumstances.

limitations.title: Leave Encashment Daily Wage Calculation Limitation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculator uses working days as the primary denominator for leave salary accrual, which varies monthly
limitations.impact: Cumulative leave salary amounts differ across months due to varying working days

limitations.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
limitations.limitation_statement: The system cannot automatically align leave salary and salary proration calculation methods without manual configuration.
limitations.impact: Potential inconsistent salary calculations across different scenarios

limitations.title: Daily Wage Proration Based on Work Week
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration for each employee, which may include all days as working days
limitations.impact: Proration calculations may differ between employees with different work week configurations

limitations.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration only works correctly when departure dates are in the past, failing to handle future departure dates during payroll processing.
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect salary calculations for employees with future offboarding dates

limitations.title: Incomplete Leave Transaction Deletion Handling
limitations.limitation_statement: The system does not automatically reconcile or remove payroll deductions when leave transactions are modified or deleted.
limitations.impact: Users may experience persistent incorrect payroll deductions that require manual intervention

limitations.title: Working Days Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated as: (basic salary + allowance) / working days, where working days exclude weekends and public holidays specific to the employee's country of residence.
limitations.impact: Salary deductions for unpaid leave depend on precise working days calculation

limitations.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Wage Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: System uses a fixed 30.42 days divisor for calculating daily wage, which may not align with exact calendar days
limitations.impact: Deduction amounts may slightly differ from expected monthly salary

limitations.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations are based on actual calendar days in the month, with specific handling required for months with varying days (particularly February in leap years).
limitations.impact: Ensures accurate pro-rata calculations for unpaid leave deductions

limitations.title: Global Settings Override Policy-Level Configurations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate is calculated as (Basic + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays. Working days are determined by total month days minus public holidays.
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations across different months

operational_reality_facts.fact_statement: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (February 29th), causing minor discrepancies in total service days and resulting gratuity amount. The system calculated 912 days, while manual calculation showed 913 days by including the leap day.

The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is from the wrong month.

The system uses specific rules for calculating service duration, including leap year adjustments and day counting methodologies that may not be immediately intuitive to users.

operational_reality_facts.fact_title: Proration Failure for Future Departure Dates
operational_reality_facts.fact_statement: The daily wage calculator fails to correctly prorate salaries for employees with future departure dates during payroll processing. When an employee's departure date is set in the future (e.g., Nov 28th) but payroll is processed earlier (e.g., Nov 27th), the system fails to prorate the salary and displays the full monthly amount instead. The system correctly prorates when the departure date is in the past, but not when it's in the future relative to the payroll processing date.

operational_reality_facts.fact_title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrect for Leap Years
operational_reality_facts.fact_statement: The system incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for leap years (specifically 2024), resulting in an inaccurate total service period and lower gratuity amount.

operational_reality_facts.fact_title: Lack of Automated Daily Wage Calculation
operational_reality_facts.fact_statement: The current system lacks automated salary calculation based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking of overtime and unpaid leaves.
